name: Format\ConditionalSection
description: The object for defining conditional properties for a section component, and when the conditional properties are in effect.

properties.name: conditions
properties.description: An instance or array of conditions that, when met, cause the conditional section component properties to take effect.

properties.name: allowAutoplacedAds
properties.description: A Boolean value that allows the placement of ad banners between components. Nested components inherit the value of the outermost container that explicitly sets allowAutoplacedAds. The default value is true.

properties.name: anchor
properties.description: An object that defines vertical alignment with another component.

properties.name: animation
properties.description:
An object that defines an animation to be applied to the component.
To remove a previously set condition, use none.

properties.name: behavior
properties.description:
An object that defines behavior for a component, like  or .
To remove a previously set condition, use none.

properties.name: contentDisplay
properties.description:
An object that defines how to position child components within this ConditionalSection component. A , for example, allows for displaying child components side by side.
In versions of News prior to iOS 11, child components are positioned as if contentDisplay were not defined.
To remove a previously set condition, use none.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the component is hidden.

properties.name: layout
properties.description:
An inline  object that contains layout information, or a string reference to a ComponentLayout object that is defined at the top level of the document. 
If layout is not defined, size and position are based on various factors, such as the device type, the length of the content, and the role of this component.

properties.name: scene
properties.description:
A set of animations applied to any header component that is a child of this section. 
To remove a previously set condition, use none.

properties.name: style
properties.description:
An inline  object that defines the appearance of this component, or a string reference to a ComponentStyle object that is defined at the top level of the document.
To remove a previously set condition, use none.
